all done.usage: Use when child finishes meals, activities, or diaper changes

want.usage: Use before offering choices. 'You WANT milk or water?'

more.usage: Use during meals, play, or any activity child enjoys

help.usage: Teach child to ask for assistance instead of getting frustrated

please.usage: Use with all requests to teach polite communication

thank you.usage: Use after receiving anything to build gratitude habits

yes.usage: Teach for making choices and expressing agreement

no.usage: Essential for expressing refusal and setting boundaries

stop.usage: Critical for safety and ending unwanted activities

go.usage: Use for transitions and movement activities

eat.usage: Use at mealtimes and when child shows hunger signs

drink.usage: Use when offering liquids or child shows thirst

milk.usage: Specific drink request, very motivating for most toddlers

water.usage: Essential daily need, use throughout the day

mom.usage: First social sign, use when mom enters room

dad.usage: Important family sign, use when dad is present

up.usage: Use when child wants to be picked up or go upstairs

down.usage: Use when child wants to get down or go downstairs

bathroom.usage: Critical for potty training and avoiding accidents

hurt.usage: Important for expressing pain instead of just crying

tired.usage: Use before naps and bedtime routines

hungry.usage: Helps child communicate need before getting cranky
